headline: Why Palantir Stock Soared in May
summary: Palantir released a mostly positive earnings report, as well as announcing several new partnerships.  The company's CEO accompanied President Trump to Saudi Arabia.  Shares of Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ: PLTR) were up in May. The company's stock finished the month up 11.3%.

headline: Palantir Technologies (NasdaqGS:PLTR) Partners With Fedrigoni To Drive AI-Powered Transformation
summary: Palantir Technologies (NasdaqGS:PLTR) recently announced a multi-year partnership with Fedrigoni to aid in digital transformation, which comes amid a significant 58% increase in its stock price over the past quarter. This collaboration reflects the importance of AI in enhancing manufacturing efficiencies. However, it's not the only development potentially influencing investor perception; the company also finalized several other partnerships in different sectors, such as healthcare and...

headline: Fedrigoni and Palantir Partner to Accelerate Operational Transformation with AI
summary: DENVER, June 10, 2025--Palantir Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ: PLTR) today announced a multi-year partnership with Fedrigoni, a global reference manufacturer of specialty papers for packaging and other creative applications, self-adhesive labels, graphic supports for visual communication, and RFID. This strategic alliance aims to accelerate Fedrigoni's digital transformation by leveraging advanced AI capabilities and Palantir's innovative solutions. Initially focused on stock optimization and demand

headline: Can a $10,000 Investment in Palantir Technologies Turn Into $1 Million?
summary: Palantir Technologies has an incredibly popular AI platform.  Revenue growth was nearly 40% year over year in Q1.  One stock that some investors think could have that potential is AI powerhouse Palantir (NASDAQ: PLTR).

headline: The 3 Best Nasdaq-100 Stocks in 2025: Wall Street Says Buy One and Sell the Others
summary: Palantir, Zscaler, and MercadoLibre are the three best-performing Nasdaq-100 stocks year to date, but most Wall Street analysts see downside in two of the tickers.  Palantir is a recognized leader in decision intelligence software, but it's also the most expensive software stock on the market by a wide margin.  MercadoLibre has fortified its retail business with add-on merchant services like advertising and logistics, and the stock's current valuation is reasonable.
